alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 815 PM MDT... At 730 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mayoworth, which is also 12 miles northwest of Kaycee, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 259 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for north central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Southeast Johnson County
